title: Bush Turnpike construction photos

pageHeader.title: Construction of Grand Prairie Frontage Roads

text: The frontage roads are State Highway 161. The Bush Turnpike main lanes on this section opened October 15, 2012. The Bush Turnpike between I-30 and I-20 was expanded to eight main lanes in 2022.

images.caption: This is the southernmost section of 161 in south Grand Prarie. These photos show work underway on the section shown by the dashed red line.
Piers for the frontage road connection at Interstate 20.
Piers for the frontage road connection at Interstate 20. Note the relief sculpture on the sides of the piers.
Piers for the frontage road connection at Interstate 20.
This is about a mile north of Interstate 20 at Mayfield Road. This view looks south along the future southbound feeder.
This view looks north along the future southbound feeder at Mayfield Road.
This view looks south along the future northbound feeder at Mayfield Road.
The next major crossing going north is Pioneer Parkway. This view looks south along the future southbound feeder at Pioneer Parkway.
Same view as above, but zoomed in.
This view looks south along the future northbound feeder at Pioneer Parkway.
Same view as above, but zoomed in.

Looking north at Pioneer Parkway, showing embankment for the future main lanes. North of Pioneer Parkway a two-lane road already existed along the freeway alignment. A project
						to replace the two-lane road with frontage roads took place from 2006 to 2009.
